page.title: 01Skelmonae
page.content: This area is mostly gently undulating farmland except for the Hills of Skelmonae and Skilmafilly where the land rises to around 150m. The main land use is miscellaneous arable farming including a potato research centre at Skelmonae. Seed from this centre is sent to England and abroad. The other main use of the land is grazing for both cattle and sheep, the hills and moorland are used for rough grazing for sheep. Pieces of land that are no use for farming have been planted with trees or left alone. People living in the area either own or work on farms or commute to Aberdeen and Peterhead where they have jobs in the Oil and Gas industries. Because the Oil and Gas people have
